description: Borrowed from Latin sulcus (“a furrow made by a plow”). Doublet of sullow ("plough").

entries.meaning: (anatomy) A furrow or groove in an organ or a tissue, especially that marking the convolutions of the surface of the brain.
examples: Hyponyms: central sulcus, cruciate sulcus, lateral sulcus

entries.meaning: (planetology) A region of subparallel grooves or ditches formed by a geological process.
